data.price: By the fig and the olive[1],
and by this secure city [of Makkah][3],
data.footnotes: [3] This passage refers to the land of the three great prophets of Allah: Jesus (ﷺ) lived in the land of figs and olives, Moses (ﷺ) communicated with Allah on Mount Sinai, and Muhammad's (ﷺ) birthplace was Makkah. There is a similar reference in Deuteronomy 33:1, [Moses said:] “The Lord came from Sinai. Rising from Seir upon us, and he shone forth from Mount Paran.” Seir is a mountain near Jerusalem, and Paran is a mountain near Makkah.

data.price: Surely We have created man in the best form[4],
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِيٓ أَحۡسَنِ تَقۡوِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., in upright and balanced form and nature.

data.price: then We will reduce him to the lowest of the low[5],
data.footnotes: [5] i.e., to the depths of Hell due to deviation from uprightness; or to decrepit old age.

data.price: except those who believe and do righteous deeds; they will have a never-ending reward.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونٖ

data.price: Then, what makes you deny the Judgment Day?
Is not Allah the Most Just of all judges?
